intro: Thelypodium versicolor, commonly known as the variable thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Thelypodium versicolor is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides, where it blooms during the warmer months.
